text:
(1) Pugsley's Creek, Bronx: A view northeastward across the mouth of the creek from the foot of Cornell Ave. In the center background is Screvin's Point, on the other side of which is Westchester Creek.

P. L. Sperr.
July 29, 1928.

(2) At the mouth of the Creek as viewed directly eastward from the same vantage point. In the background is Old Ferry Point on which is located the House of the Good Shepherd.

P. L. Sperr.
July 29, 1928.
title: Pugsley Creek - Bronx - Cornell Avenue - [House of The Good Shepherd.]
